prompt: Hilary Duff is a renowned American actress, singer, author, and businesswoman. Please write a short biography of Hilary Duff.
response:
Hilary Duff is a talented and multifaceted American entertainer, born on September 28, 1987, in Houston, Texas. From a young age, Hilary showcased her passion for the performing arts, starting with dance and gymnastics competitions.

Hilary's breakout role came in 2001 when she landed the title character in the hit Disney Channel series "Lizzie McGuire," earning her a Golden Globe nomination and a dedicated fan base. The show's success led to the release of the hit soundtrack album "Lizzie McGuire Movie Soundtrack," which debuted at number 1 on the US Billboard 200 chart.

As her acting career took off, Hilary began to explore her musical talents, releasing her debut album "Metamorphosis" in 2003, which included the chart-topping single "So Yesterday." She went on to release two more successful albums, "Hilary Duff" in 2004 and "Dignity" in 2007.

In addition to her music and television career, Hilary has appeared in several films, including "Cheaper by the Dozen," "A Cinderella Story," and "Material Girls." She has also made her mark on the stage, starring in the Broadway production of "Rock of Ages" in 2012.

Beyond her entertainment ventures, Hilary has been recognized for her philanthropic work, particularly in the area of children's health and education. She has been a long-time supporter of the Starlight Children's Foundation and has participated in numerous charity events and campaigns.

Throughout her career, Hilary has received numerous awards and nominations, including a Daytime Emmy Award, a Teen Choice Award, and a People's Choice Award. With her impressive resume and continued success, Hilary Duff has solidified her status as a beloved and respected figure in the entertainment industry.

Today, Duff is a beloved figure in Hollywood, known for her dedication to her craft, her kindness to her fans, and her commitment to philanthropic causes.
